items.title: England to face Scotland in quarter-finals after thrashing Australia
items.summary: England recover from a shaky first-half showing to comprehensively beat Australia 47-7 to set up a Women's Rugby World Cup quarter-final against Scotland.

items.title: Scotland 'miss lift and have to take the stairs'
items.summary: Scotland face a daunting World Cup quarter-final with hosts England next Sunday, but the underdogs insist they can show some bite.

items.title: Scotland 'have to take stairs' after missing lift in World Cup
items.summary: Scotland face a daunting World Cup quarter-final with hosts England next Sunday, but the underdogs insist they can show some bite.

items.title: Patchy England beat Australia to set up Scotland quarter-final
items.summary: England recovered from a glitchy first-half showing to beat Australia and set up a Women's Rugby World Cup quarter-final against Scotland,

items.title: Who 'didn't have his best game'? How England's players rated
items.summary: Who impressed for England in their World Cup qualifier against Andorra? Alex Howell rates the players.

items.title: Leigh end long wait for win at Warrington
items.summary: Leigh win at Warrington for the first time in more than 38 years to pile more late-season misery on Sam Burgess' Wolves.

items.title: Leon Thomas, GELO, Ravyn Lenae & More Tear the Roof Off New Yorkâ€™s Webster Hall During Billboardâ€™s R&B/Hip-HopÂ Concert
items.summary: The Sept. 5 show was one of many events held during Billboardâ€™s R&B/Hip-Hop Week.
items.body: When word got out that the Billboard R&B/Hip-Hop Power Players event would be taking over Webster Hall for a free concert on Friday (Sept. 5), New Yorkers from all walks of life consumed three blocks waiting â€” and hoping â€” to get inside. Those lucky enough to gain entry celebrated every second of the night, as DJ Ohso meticulously spun through hip-hop bangers, sultry afro tunes and a little bit of Paramore to keep the crowd energized, engaged and hungry for a showcase from Billboard ‘s Rookies of the Year. Related Leon Thomas Accepts Breakthrough of Year Award at Billboardâ€™s 2025 R&B/Hip-Hop Power Players: ‘God Is Good All the Time’ Cardi B, Leon Thomas & More Honored at Billboard R&B/Hip-Hop Power Players 2025: Best Photos Anthony ‘Top Dawg’ Tiffith Accepts Executive of the Year at Billboard’s 2025 R&B/Hip-Hop Power Players: ‘Feel Like I Should’ve Won This 3, 4, 5 Times’ Armanii kicked the night off with his signature blend of dancehall and hip-hop grooves, as fans swayed to “8:00 PM,” “JUMP (Bounce)” and others. Attendee’s workday blues than completely vanished â€¦

items.title: Red Roses embracing 'World Cup fever' unlike men in 2015 - George
items.summary: Former England hooker Jamie George praises the Red Roses for embracing the home atmosphere better than the men's team did at their home World Cup in 2015.

items.title: 'Lived up to Â£1m price tag' - pundits on Smith's Arsenal debut
items.summary: BBC Sport pundits Fara Williams and Ellen White analyse the performance of new Arsenal signing Olivia Smith after a dream debut against London City Lionesses.

items.title: Coutya wins gold at Para Fencing Worlds
items.summary: British wheelchair fencer Dimitri Coutya beats China's Yanke Feng to win gold at the Para Fencing World Championships.

items.title: Wardley to fight Parker in London on 25 October
items.summary: Unbeaten British heavyweight Fabio Wardley will fight former world champion Joseph Parker at London's O2 Arena on 25 October.

items.title: McIlroy stays in hunt for first win since Masters
items.summary: Rory McIlroy maintains his bid for a second Irish Open title as a bogey-free 68 leaves him four shots off the pace going into the final round at the K Club.

items.title: Dua Lipa Performs â€˜Ainâ€™t Nobodyâ€™ With Chaka Khan at U.S. Tour Opener inÂ Chicago
items.summary: The pop star launched the U.S. leg of her Radical Optimism at the United Center on Sept. 5.
items.body: Dua Lipa treated fans to a surprise during the opening U.S. date of her Radical Optimism World Tour. On Friday (Sept. 5), the 30-year-old British pop star launched a two-night stint at Chicagoâ€™s United Center, dazzling the sold-out crowd with striking costumes and a 22-song setlist that featured tracks from her latest album, Radical Optimism . Related Dua Lipa Covers Aretha Franklin in Liberating Short Film for YSL’s Libre Eau de Parfum: Shop the Fragrance ‘I’ve Always Had a Special Love for Toronto’: 6 Best Moments From Dua Lipa’s North American Tour Kick-Off Dua Lipa’s ‘Levitating’ Music Video Soars Past 1 Billion Views on YouTube Midway through her performance, Lipa â€” dressed in a sparkly black coat with feathered sleeves â€” stunned fans by welcoming music legend Chaka Khan to the stage. Together, the duo performed a powerful rendition of Khanâ€™s 1983 classic â€œAinâ€™t Nobody.â€ Watch fan-captured footage of the moment here . This isnâ€™t the first time Lipa has shared the stage with iconic artists during her global tour. Earlier this year, she was joined by Crowded Houseâ€™s Neil Finn during a stop in New Zealand, and later â€¦

items.title: Overton replaces Mahmood for England in third ODI
items.summary: Jamie Overton is named in England's team for the third and final one-day international against South Africa in Southampton on Sunday at the expense of Saqib Mahmood.

items.title: USA thrash Samoa to keep slim World Cup hopes alive
items.summary: The USA keep their World Cup quarter-final hopes alive with a 10-try win over Samoa in their final match in Pool A, and now wait on Australia's result against England.

items.title: Eladio CarriÃ³n Delivers Next-Level Energy at Barclays Center With Star Guests, Retro-Futuristic Visuals & Yakuza Flair: 5 BestÂ Moments
items.summary: The Puerto Rican rapper made his arena debut in NYC, and brought Young Miko, Rich the Kid, and more to the stage as part of his DON KBRN World Tour.
items.body: Eladio CarriÃ³n is no stranger to breaking barriers, and his explosive takeover of Brooklynâ€™s Barclays Center proved once again that heâ€™s operating on a whole new level. In just two years, the U.S.-born, Puerto Rican rapper elevated his career from performing in intimate venues like The Theater at Madison Square Garden to headlining arena territory at the Barclays Center. His arrival in New York City comes one week after he launched his DON KBRN World Tour, presented by Live Nation, on Aug. 27 in Charlotte, N.C. Kicking off the show at 9 p.m., the Kansas City-born artist lit up the stage with tracks from his latest album DON KBRN , including fan favorites like â€œInvencible,â€ â€œOhtani,â€ â€œVetements,â€ â€œH.I.M.â€ and â€œBroly.â€ He also performed songs from his albums Sol MarÃ­a (2024), 3MEN2 KBRN (2023), SEN2KBRN VOL. 2 (2022), Sauce Boyz 2 (2021), and his 2024 EP Porque Puedo . (See the full setlist here .) Over the course of two hours, the Latin trap star delivered a show packed with jaw-dropping yakuza-inspired visuals, surprise guests â€” Young Miko, Rich the Kid, Ty Dolla $ign, Lenny TavÃ¡rez, J Quiles â€” and undeniable energy.  Next, the Sauce Boyz hitmaker will bring his electrifâ€¦

items.title: Karol G Dazzles With Tropical NFL Halftime Show in SÃ£o Paulo: â€˜Hey,Â Brazil!â€™
items.summary: The Colombian star headlined the season opener spectacle on Friday (Sept. 5).
items.body: Karol G brought her Tropicoqueta energy to the NFL stage in Brazil, where she headlined the halftime show on Friday night (Sept. 5) during the season opener between the Kansas City Chiefs and the Los Angeles Chargers. Related Karol G Expands Winning Streak on Latin Airplay Chart With â€˜Latina Forevaâ€™ Milo J, Grupo Firme, Sech & More: Who Had the Best New Latin Music Release This Week? Which New Music Release Is Your Favorite This Week? Vote! The Colombian superstar’s performance was streamed live on the NFLâ€™s YouTube channel from Corinthians Arena in SÃ£o Paulo, where she opened her short-but-dazzling set singing some verses in Portuguese, before switching to Spanish for “Bandida Entrenada.” “Hey, Brazil!” she greeted the audience with excitement. “Â¡Arriba mi gente latina!” (Up my Latin people!) Dressed in a brown and yellow miniskirt with copper details and a bra with yellow pineapples for cups, Karol, with her wavy dark blond hair down, performed a medley that included her Billboard Hot Latin Songs No. 1 hit “Si Antes Te Hubiera Conocido,” “Un Gatito Me LlamÃ³” and “Papasito,” which she performedâ€¦

items.title: Can SoundExchange Bring Lawsuits? SiriusXM Appeal Will Shape RoyaltiesÂ Enforcement
items.summary: SoundExchange says an "erroneous ruling" incorrectly barred it from collecting royalties via litigation.
items.body: A major court ruling last month found that SoundExchange doesnâ€™t have the power to collect royalties through litigation. Now, the organization has launched an appeal in hopes of preserving this enforcement strategy. SoundExchangeâ€™s notice of appeal on Friday (Sept. 5) challenges an August federal court ruling that dismissed its $400 million lawsuit against SiriusXM. Judge Naomi Reice Buchwald held in her decision that SoundExchange, a nonprofit designated by the Copyright Royalty Board to collect performance royalties for artists, does not actually have the right to sue anybody under federal law. Related SoundExchange Loses SiriusXM Lawsuit: Judge Says Royalties Org Is â€˜Not a Legal Advocacy Group’ Tileyard Education and BMG Production Library Release Four New EPs Showcasing Emerging Songwriters Miranda Lambert Set to Headline Colorado's Ford Amphitheater on Sept. 28 This ruling was the first to weigh in on SoundExchangeâ€™s standing to collect recorded royalties via lawsuits, and the implications are big. For more than a decade, the organization has regularly used litigation to secure hundreds of millions of dollars in royalties from radio broadcasters like SiriusXM â€¦

items.title: In Canada: Alex Warren Speaks Out After Exiting Sommo Festival, Says â€˜Iâ€™m Going Through aÂ Lotâ€™
items.summary: In other Canadian industry news this week, Karan Aujla sets a Punjabi-language chart record and Paul Haagenson joins Bruce Allen Entertainment.
items.body: Alex Warren is doing something un ordinary for a pop star. On Sep. 3, organizers of P.E.Iâ€™s Sommo Festival shared that the â€œOrdinaryâ€ singer withdrew from the event due to â€œa recently booked scheduling conflict,â€ in a now-deleted social post. Related Alex Warrenâ€™s â€˜Ordinaryâ€™ Is Billboardâ€™s No. 1 Global Song of the Summer for 2025 Tileyard Education and BMG Production Library Release Four New EPs Showcasing Emerging Songwriters Miranda Lambert Set to Headline Colorado's Ford Amphitheater on Sept. 28 “With the festival being next week, as you can imagine, this leaves us in a difficult position,” they wrote. “We are working hard to complete the lineup, and you’ll be the first to know when we do.” Warren was set to join the East Coast two-day festival from September 13-14, with headliners Hozier and Alanis Morissette, and support from Ducks Ltd., PVRIS, Alice Merton, Chiara Savasta, Michael Marcagi, Hollow Coves and more. Later that night, the chart-topping star took to TikTok to share his perspective â€” and set the record straight. â€œFour weeks ago, I asked for time off. Iâ€™m going through a lot of stuff, Iâ€™ve been touring all year, I have rehearsâ€¦

items.title: Sphere Entertainment Stock Jumps for Second Week on â€˜Wizard of Ozâ€™Â Hype
items.summary: The Billboard Global Music Index rose 1.7% to 3,301.18, bringing its year-to-date gain to 42.7%.
items.body: Sphere Entertainment Co. was the top-performing music stock for the second consecutive week after gaining 7.8% to $48.90 for the week ended Sept. 5. After rising 6.8% the previous week, Sphere Entertainment rode continued enthusiasm for the revamped The Wizard of Oz that debuted at Sphere on Aug. 28. On Wednesday (Sept. 3), the stock reached a 52-week high of $49.98 after the company announced it repurchased $27.5 million of common stock, putting it within reach of its all-time high of $51.19 set in February 2021. Related Which Music Companies Had the Best Stock Returns in the Last Three Years? Tileyard Education and BMG Production Library Release Four New EPs Showcasing Emerging Songwriters Miranda Lambert Set to Headline Colorado's Ford Amphitheater on Sept. 28 German concert promoter CTS Eventim was the No. 2 music stock of the week, rising 5.5% to 84.45 euros ($98.99). On Tuesday, Rothschild & Co. upgraded CTS Eventim to a â€œbuyâ€ rating and lowered its price target to 105.00 euros ($123.08) from 109.00 euros ($127.77).  Spotify was No. 3 after gaining 3.6% to $707.19. On Wednesday, Guggenheim reiterated its â€œbuyâ€ rating and $850 price target for Spotify whileâ€¦

items.title: Damon Dash Declares Bankruptcy, Citing More Than $25M in Debts
items.summary: The Roc-A-Fella Records co-founder owes quite a bit of money in tax bills, unpaid child support and court judgments.
items.body: Roc-A-Fella Records co-founder Damon Dash has filed for bankruptcy, saying he has just over $4,000 to his name and owes more than $25 million in tax bills, child support and court judgments. Dash, who co-founded Roc-A-Fella with Jay-Z and Kareem â€œBiggsâ€ Burke in 1994, is seeking to clear his debts through a so-called Chapter 7 bankruptcy petition filed Thursday (Sept. 4) in Florida. It comes almost exactly a year after Dashâ€™s one-third interest in Roc-A-Fella was auctioned off to the state of New York due to these same debts. Related Judge Postpones Auction of Damon Dash’s Roc-A-Fella Stake. Here’s Why It’ll Now Cost a Lot More Tileyard Education and BMG Production Library Release Four New EPs Showcasing Emerging Songwriters Miranda Lambert Set to Headline Colorado's Ford Amphitheater on Sept. 28 According to the petition, Dash has just $100 in cash on hand and a few possessions worth a total of $4,250. These items include $2,500 worth of jewelry, plus a cellphone, clothes and two guns. Dashâ€™s debts far outweigh his assets. He claims to owe a whopping $25.3 million, $19 million of which is composed of unpaid taxes to authorities in New York, New Jersey â€¦

items.title: â€˜Soda Popâ€™ Choreographer Lee Jung Says Sheâ€™s Ready to Move From Saja Boys to BTS After Success of â€˜KPop DemonÂ Huntersâ€™
items.summary: THE BLACK LABEL choreographer also created the moves for HUNTR/X's "How It's Done" in the hit Netflix film.
items.body: KPop Demon Hunters has shattered records once again. After becoming the most-watched film in Netflix history, standout track “Golden” went on to top the Billboard Hot 100 chart (for three weeks so far). As a film centered around K-pop, this is more than just a box-office milestone; itâ€™s a landmark in the history of the genre itself. Related ‘Golden’ Choreographer Jo Na-In ‘Stunned & Thrilled’ That ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ Song Topped Hot 100, Wants to Work With Lady Gaga Next Dua Lipa Covers Aretha Franklin in Liberating Short Film for YSL's Libre Eau de Parfum: Shop the Fragrance Kansas City Chiefs vs. Los Angeles Chargers: How to Watch NFL Game in Brazil Online for Free So why has this film resonated so strongly? This can be understood in the same context as K-popâ€™s global popularity. Throughout its evolution, K-pop has consistently maintained a balance between music, performance and choreography. Performance videos have become almost mandatory alongside K-pop music videos, and every comeback promotion is accompanied by a dance challenge. K-pop is never just the music â€” it is the music with performance. In the same way, Kâ€¦

items.title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
